attributes.action: ask the Minister of Transport, Sadiq Khan, to give to the businessess and communities who use the Severn Bridge crossing, the same committment he gave recently to users of the Humber Bridge
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Help must be given to ease the cost burden on companies carrying out business in Wales and reviewing the way the tolls are charged on business users would be a great start. Announcing a £6m grant to help cover the maintenance costs of the Humber Bridge, the Minister said "the government is committed to doing everything it can to protect communities and businesses from economic downturn and to help the country recover. This is why I recently decided not to accept the Humber Bridge board's proposed toll increases". The users of the Severn Bridge pay the highest tolls in the country and, by adding VAT to the charges, the government has extended the date the bridge is due to revert back to the state by 2 years to approx. 2016.
